paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: In the LORD put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the Lord put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?

paragraphs.content: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.

paragraphs.content: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?
paragraphs.contentHtml: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?

paragraphs.content: The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORD’s throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord is in his holy temple, the Lord’s throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.

paragraphs.content: The LORD trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.

paragraphs.content: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.

paragraphs.content: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the righteous Lord loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.
